intro: Seyrigia marnieri, commonly known as the Madagascar dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Seyrigia marnieri is a relatively rare species with limited distribution, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
